Package org.semanticweb.rulewerk.parser

Interface DirectiveHandler<T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ImportFileDirectiveHandler, ImportFileRelativeDirectiveHandler
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
    @FunctionalInterface
public interface DirectiveHandler<T>
    Handler for parsing a custom directive.
    Author:
    Maximilian Marx

    • Method Detail

      • handleDirective

        T handleDirective​(List<Argument> arguments,
                  SubParserFactory subParserFactory)
           throws ParsingException
        Parse a Directive. This is called by the parser to parse directives.
        Parameters:
        arguments - Arguments given to the Directive statement.
        subParserFactory - a factory for obtaining a SubParser, sharing the parser's state, but bound to new input.
        Returns:
        a T instance corresponding to the given arguments.
        Throws:
        ParsingException - when any of the arguments is invalid for the directive, or the number of arguments is invalid.

      • validateNumberOfArguments

        static void validateNumberOfArguments​(List<Argument> arguments,
                                      int number)
                               throws ParsingException
        Validate the provided number of arguments to the directive statement.
        Parameters:
        arguments - Arguments given to the Directive statement.
        number - expected number of arguments
        Throws:
        ParsingException - when the given number of Arguments is invalid for the Directive statement.

      • validateStringArgument

        static String validateStringArgument​(Argument argument,
                                     String description)
                              throws ParsingException
        Validate that the provided argument is a String.
        Parameters:
        argument - the argument to validate
        description - a description of the argument, used in constructing the error message.
        Returns:
        the contained String.
        Throws:
        ParsingException - when the given argument is not a String.

      • validateFilenameArgument

        static File validateFilenameArgument​(Argument argument,
                                     String description,
                                     String importBasePath)
                              throws ParsingException
        Validate that the provided argument is a file path.
        Parameters:
        argument - the argument to validate
        description - a description of the argument, used in constructing the error message
        importBasePath - the path that relative file names are resolved against
        Returns:
        the File corresponding to the contained file path
        Throws:
        ParsingException - when the given argument is not a valid file path

      • validateTermArgument

        static Term validateTermArgument​(Argument argument,
                                 String description)
                          throws ParsingException
        Validate that the provided argument is a Term.
        Parameters:
        argument - the argument to validate
        description - a description of the argument, used in constructing the error message.
        Returns:
        the contained Term.
        Throws:
        ParsingException - when the given argument is not a Term.
